title: Dataset Augmentation by Mixing Visual Concepts
abstract:
This paper proposes a dataset augmentation method by fine-tuning pre-trained
diffusion models. Generating images using a pre-trained diffusion model with
textual conditioning often results in domain discrepancy between real data and
generated images. We propose a fine-tuning approach where we adapt the
diffusion model by conditioning it with real images and novel text embeddings.
We introduce a unique procedure called Mixing Visual Concepts (MVC) where we
create novel text embeddings from image captions. The MVC enables us to
generate multiple images which are diverse and yet similar to the real data
enabling us to perform effective dataset augmentation. We perform comprehensive
qualitative and quantitative evaluations with the proposed dataset augmentation
approach showcasing both coarse-grained and finegrained changes in generated
images. Our approach outperforms state-of-the-art augmentation techniques on
benchmark classification tasks.
subjects: Computer Science/Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
